page.title: 17ST. LEONARDS CHURCH
page.content:
{ ST. LEONARD'S CHURCH, COTHERIDGE
The 1961 ordnance survey map shows the church as 'in ruins', but it is, in fact, in the process of restor- ation and is partly usable. It is a small church, for many years closely associated with the Berkeley family of Cotheridge Court. The chancel and nave date from the 12th century and are of plastered sandstone. A timber tower of chestnut and oak, with hipped roof, was added in the 15th century. During the 17th century the North Chapel and the panelled box pews were were built and the church generally restored. It is situated down a lane about five kilometres from Worcester on the A44 road to Bromyard.
